definition: to provide support/to come to the rescue
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: Sun Quan, fearing for Ling Tong, ordered Lv Meng to bring him back to camp.
sentences.chinese: 孫權恐淩統有失，令呂蒙接應回營。

sentences.english: In football the linebacker backs up the linemen.
sentences.chinese: 在足球賽中後衛接應前鋒。

sentences.english: He calls Bellick and Sucre to have them meet him out back.
sentences.chinese: 他打電話叫巴利克和蘇克雷在後面接應他。

sentences.english: Di Jian has a person operating from within in coordination with outside forces and supply already, he found two nucleuses successfully to play.
sentences.chinese: 狄堅早已有內應和接應，他成功地找到了兩枚核彈。

sentences.english: He sidefooted the ball in from close range after Thierry Henry had headed across a free-kick.
sentences.chinese: 他在接應亨利的頭球擺渡後破門得分。

sentences.english: Low-voltage alarm, with interface connected to external emergency power supply.
sentences.chinese: 低壓告警，具有外接應急電電源接口。

sentences.english: Zhao and money surrounded by two escape, outside have zheng takes seven.
sentences.chinese: 趙大和錢二逃出包圍，外有鄭七接應。

definition: to open fire/to shoot a gun
to gallop/speedily/to proceed to/to pilot (ship, plane etc)/to sail
to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc)/a substitute/a replacement
to burst or force open a door/to excommunicate sb (from the Roman Catholic Church)/to score a goal (in football, hockey etc)
